alert.note: Alert for Gage; Jefferson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 11 at 5:29PM CDT until June 11 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND WEST CENTRAL GAGE COUNTIES... At 529 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 3 miles southeast of Plymouth, or 9 miles west of Beatrice, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Jefferson and west central Gage Counties, including the following locations... Ellis and Homestead National Historical Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
